Job_Title: Company Secretary Admin Assistant
Job_Description: RESPONSIBILITIES To help organize meetings for the Board, related Committees and Shareholders, prepare relevant documents and coordinate with relevant parties to ensure all resolutions have been implemented To ensure full compliance of the Company with Corporate Governance and other relevant statutory and regulatory requirements To provide professional advice and recommendation for the Board and management with regards to Corporate Governance, statutory regulatory and governmental requirements, and best practice To manage accuracy and confidentiality of statutory documents to be filed with Companies Registry and other relevant authorities for annual and extraordinary general meetings of shareholders To liaise with relevant authorities, including but not limited to SET and SEC, to circulate, prepare and submit any related documents and announcements To liaise with various entities on company secretarial duties within the Group To handle ad-hoc duties as assigned JOB SPECIFICATION Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Corporate Governance, Law, or other related fields Minimum 3 years of experience as Company Secretary in a SET listed company Strong knowledge in SEC and SET rules and regulations, Listed company & Stock Exchange Acts and Thai Corporate and Commercial Laws Well-organized, good interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills Responsible, proactive, able to work under pressure in a dynamic environment and uphold confidentiality Excellent command in both written and spoken English and Thai Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Job_Title: Admin. Tracking/เจ้าหน้าที่ประสานงานศูนย์บริการ/ เจ้าหน้าที่แผนกปฏิบัติการ/...
Job_Description: Overview (ภาพรวม) : บริษัท อินสุวรรณ์ เทคนิคัล เซอร์วิสเซส จำกัด เป็นผู้ให้บริการงานเกี่ยวกับเครื่องปรับอากาศแบบครบวงจร ไม่ว่าจะเป็นเครื่องปรับอากาศสำหรับที่พักอาศัย อาคารสำนักงาน และอาคารโรงงานทุกชนิด ผ่านการทำงานหลากหลายรูปแบบ อาทิเช่น งานซ่อมแซม งานติดตั้งรื้อถอน งานล้างทำความสะอาด งานตรวจสอบระบบ/งานตรวจสอบการติดตั้ง รวมถึงการจัดหาและจัดจำหน่ายเครื่องปรับอากาศ          วัสดุอุปกรณ์ และอะไหล่ที่เกี่ยวข้องกับงานเครื่องปรับอากาศ เป็นต้น ในปัจจุบันบริษัทฯ ได้รับการแต่งตั้งจาก บริษัท ไทยซัมซุง อิเลคทรอนิกส์ จำกัด ให้เป็นตัวแทนศูนย์บริการงานเครื่องปรับอากาศ (Exclusive Service Center (ESC))ภายใต้สังกัดแบรนด์เครื่องปรับอากาศ SAMSUNG โดยทำงานภายใต้ระบบการทำงานมาตรฐานของศูนย์บริการ SAMSUNG เต็มรูปแบบเพื่อดูแลและให้บริการลูกค้าของ SAMSUNG โดยเฉพาะอย่างยิ่งเครื่องปรับอากาศและระบบเครื่องปรับอากาศ/ ระบบทำความเย็นขนาดใหญ่ประเภท System Air Conditioning (SAC)  หรือ SAMSUNGDVM-S โดยดูแลลูกค้าทั้งในเขตกรุงเทพมหานคร ปริมณฑล และจังหวัดพื้นที่ใกล้เคียง ครอบคลุมมากถึง 17 จังหวัด บริษัทฯ กำลังมองหาและเปิดรับสมัครทีมงานแผนกปฏิบิตการ (Operations) – Admin. Tracking/ เจ้าหน้าที่ประสานงานศูนย์บริการ/ เจ้าหน้าที่แผนกปฏิบัติการ/ ผู้ช่วยผู้จัดการศูนย์บริการ จำนวน 1 อัตรา เพื่อเพิ่มศักยภาพการทำงาน รองรับการขยายตัวทางธุรกิจและปริมาณงานที่เพิ่มมากขึ้น โดยทำหน้าที่ติดต่อประสานงานทั้งภายในและภายนอกองค์กร ดูแลแผนการทำงานและตารางการนัดหมายลูกค้า ตลอดจนติดตามปัญหาและสรุปผลการทำงานประจำวันเพื่อเสนอผู้จัดการศูนย์บริการ เพื่อให้เป็นไปตาม KPIs มาตรฐานของศูนย์บริการ จัดทำรายงานที่จำเป็นต่างๆ เพื่อเสนอฝ่ายบริหาร Job Description (รายละเอียดงานโดยสังเขป) : ติดต่อประสานงานทั่วไปทั้งภายในและภายนอกองค์กร กดรับงานที่ได้รับมอบหมายจาก บริษัท ไทยซัมซุง อิเลคทรอนิกส์ จำกัด -  SAMSUNG โดยระบบ GSPN ตามระบบการทำงานมาตรฐานของศูนย์บริการ SAMSUNG ดูแลแผนการทำงานและตารางการนัดหมายลูกค้า ติดต่อลูกค้าเพื่อยืนยันการนัดหมายและสื่อสารรายละเอียดการทำงานที่จำเป็น (Queue Planner) ติดต่อประสานงาน สอบถามปัญหาและรายละเอียดความต้องการในการเข้าให้บริการจากลูกค้าเบื้องต้น (Triage Call) และประสานงานทำงานร่วมกับทีมงานช่างบริการในการแก้ไขปัญหาให้กับลูกค้า ประสานงานทำงานร่วมกับ Sales Coordinator / Project Coordinator เพื่อจัดทำใบเสนอราคาให้กับลูกค้า ประสานงานทำงานร่วมกับ Parts Controller เพื่อจัดหา และจัดเตรียมอะไหล่ในการเข้าให้บริการลูกค้าได้อย่างถูกต้องครบถ้วน ทันเวลา อัพเดทสถานะการทำงานประจำวัน พร้อมทั้งรายงานปัญหาและสรุปผลการทำงานประจำวัน/ ประจำสัปดาห์/ ประจำเดือน ให้กับผู้จัดการศูนย์บริการ ผู้บริหาร และลูกค้า และ/ หรือผู้ที่เกี่ยวข้องทราบ ตรวจสอบและติดตามกระบวนการการทำงานของทีมช่างบริการรายวัน เพื่อให้มั่นใจว่าการทำงานเป็นไปตามวิธีการและมาตรฐานการทำงานของศูนย์บริการ SAMSUNG และตาม SOP ที่กำหนด ปิดงานที่ได้รับมอบหมายประจำวัน (งานที่เสร็จเรียบร้อย) ผ่านทางระบบ GSPN ตามระบบการทำงานมาตรฐานของศูนย์บริการ SAMSUNG Qualification (คุณสมบัติ) : อายุ 20ปี ขึ้นไป การศึกษาวุฒิปริญญาตรีหรือเทียบเท่า สาขาการเงิน การบัญชี  บริหารธุรกิจ การจัดการ หรือสาขาอื่นๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้อง มีความละเอียดรอบคอบ มีความรับผิดชอบสูง มีปฎิภาณไหวพริบ และสามารถแก้ไขปัญหาเฉพาะหน้าได้ดี สามารถใช้ Microsoft Office เช่น Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook และอื่นๆ ได้ มีประสบการณ์การทำงานไม่น้อยกว่า 1 ปี ขยัน อดทน รักงานบริการและชอบเรียนรู้ สามารถทำงานร่วมกับผู้อื่น หรือทำงานเป็นทีมได้ สามารถทำงานล่วงเวลาได้ Compensation (ค่าตอบแทน) : เงินเดือน 13,000.00 – 20,000.00 (ตามตำแหน่งงานที่รับผิดชอบ) ค่าตำแหน่ง (ตามตำแหน่งงานที่รับผิดชอบ) โบนัส (ตามผลงาน) เบี้ยขยันและโบนัสพิเศษเบี้ยขยัน ประกันสังคมและกองทุนเงินทดแทน ประกันอุบัติเหตุแบบกลุ่ม ตรวจสุขภาพประจำปี วันหยุดพักผ่อนประจำปี/ วันลาพักร้อน งานเลี้ยงสังสรรค์ประจำปี / ประจำไตรมาส การฝึกอบรมหลักสูตรที่จำเป็นต่อการปฏิบัติงาน ผู้สมัครที่สนใจสามารถสอบถามข้อมูลเพิ่มเติม หรือติดต่อที่แผนกทรัพยากรบุคคล บริษัท อินสุวรรณ์ เทคนิคัล เซอร์วิสเซส จำกัด คุณสโรชา;  คุณชุลีพร เบอร์โทรศัพท์ 02-1306867 , 095 -5612314

Job_Title: Legal Officer
Job_Description: Overall values: Passionate in Aura. Strong passion in bringing a high-quality medical service to everyone at a reasonable price. Always stay in a fast-paced, revenue-driven work environment. Always analyze and optimize on-the-go. We are bringing the aesthetic industry towards a new break through, there will be many obstacles. Persevere through all of them. We value high-growth employees and reward them handsomely. Evaluate and give constructive feedback your team to support high-growth career path. Excellent presentation skill with strong logical thinking. Excellent management skill. Always plan ahead. Always have backup plan. Strong can-do attitude. Always strive only for the best. Always go beyond expectation. Always set an almost impossible goal. Never settle for an easy one. Purpose of the position: To ensure legal compliance and provide expert guidance on legal matters related to the business's operations. Key Responsibilities: Legal Compliance: Monitor and assess the clinic's compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and licensing requirements. Develop and implement internal policies and procedures to ensure compliance with legal standards. Contract Drafting and Review: Prepare, review, and negotiate contracts, agreements, and legal documents. This includes lease agreements, vendor contracts, employment contracts, and client consent forms. Ensure legal protection and compliance while safe guarding the clinic's interests. Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on relevant laws, regulations, and guidelines governing the aesthetic industry in Thailand. Monitor changes in legislation and provide timely advice to management on potential impacts and necessary adjustments to business operations. Licensing and Permitting: Facilitate the acquisition and renewal of licenses, permits, and certifications required for the clinic's operations. Coordinate with relevant authorities and government agencies to ensure all necessary documents are obtained and maintained. Legal Advice and Risk Management: Provide legal advice and guidance to management and staff on various legal matters, including but not limited to healthcare regulations, data privacy, intellectual property, and employment law. Identify potential legal risks and propose strategies to mitigate them. Dispute Resolution: Assist in resolving legal disputes, including patient complaints, contract disputes, and employment-related issues. Collaborate with external legal counsel when necessary and represent the clinic's interests during legal proceedings. Key Qualifications & Skills: Bachelor's Degree in Law or higher. Barrister-at-law and/or lawyer license would be an advantage. At least 2 - 3years of experience ni legal work or corporate. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Strong contract drafting and negotiation skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex legal concepts in simple terms. Life at Aura Semi-flexible Office hour: 9.30-18.30 Smart Casual Dress Code 2-min walk from BTS Chongnonsi (Sathorn) Positive-energetic teammates Free lunch Unlimited snacks and drinks Annual vaccination Premium Health and Life insurance High yield, high pop up Provident Fund plan Child Education Benefits Clinic service for free or at great cost Extra Benefits to keep your Professional Look and Feel Fit Special member price with Fitness first and Virgin Active Thailand Entertainment zone; Nintendo switch, PS, Board games etc. Shower room with hotel amenities Luxury massage chair to keep office syndrome away Sleep box, take a rest and get up with fresher energy and much more! Explore us at IG: life.at.aura

Job_Title: Sale admin contractor/เจ้าหน้าที่ประสานงานการขาย
Job_Description: Job Summary: For the Sale Admin Contractor role, there is a responsibility for managing issues and ensuring smooth operations related to various documents within the company, particularly in the areas of customer service, finance, accounting, and promoting the sales of Brown-Forman Thailand. The owner of this position will work under  Brown-Forman Thailand structure. Job Responsibilities: ● Coordinate with the Finance Manager, Customer Services, and Sale teams regarding Billing and collection process. ● Verify invoice return from warehouse (Check receiver's signature and stamp following customer policy to prevent customer pay overdue from billing issue) this means we complete the delivery to the customer and completed billing and collection documents all of the customers (Thailand have 50-60 customers) ● POs request (office supplies) POSTING INVOICES ON VENDOR ● order stationery and office supplies. ● coordinate with Claim insurance. ● Validate accuracy of discount and process payment in SAP Required Experience & Education: Education: College/University (Bachelors or Equivalent); Preferred Experience & Education: Finance/accounting/sale admin Experience: No preferred Ability to work remotely and independently as part of a team Knowledge of Microsoft Excel (or Google Sheets) Financial / ERP System – SAP (FI/CO/BW) Excellent time management skills Job Competencies: Ability to multitask, work under pressure and meet deadlines required Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills Quality Orientation Proactive & shows initiative in continuous improvement

Job_Title: Executive Assistant To GM/ผู้ช่วยผู้บริหาร GM
Job_Description: Main purpose of the role: Collaborative; Openly engage stakeholders for critical activities. Take accountability and ensure effective collaboration with cross-department functions. Key accountabilities: Project management with strong communication skills Data analysis skills for strategic development plan Handle confidential information, maintain an organized filing system of paper and electronic documents. Handle incoming and outgoing documents for the executive’s consideration. Greeting and directing visitors. Miscellaneous administrative support as required (e.g. Letters, presentations, correspondence, expense reports, etc.). We're looking for person with competencies: Communication skills; Communicate clearly, both in writing and verbally, in order to build trustable relationships with shopping malls, coworkers, and executives, Time Management; Prioritize and plan work activities as to use time efficiently while handling a high volume, diverse workload, Multitasking; Able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and ability to work under the pressure, Integrity; Trustworthy enough to handle sensitive/confidential information and being able to comprehend and act on complex, sensitive matters, Analytical and problem-solving skills; Identify issues and resolve problems in a timely manner using creativity and good judgment, Administrative skills; Demonstrate proficiency in computer word processing, spreadsheet, database applications. Understand financial/HR processes and applications. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degrees to any fields study, Minimum 5 years of experience working, preferably as an executive assistant or related, Good command in written and spoken English (Being able to speak Chinese will be an added advantage) Good computer skills Contact : K.Nong 080-9756691

Job_Title: Sales Administrator/ธุรการฝ่ายขาย
Job_Description: Responsibilities: Sales Support: Assist the sales team in planning, coordinating, scheduling meetings, organizing seminars, and managing information within the organization, with partners, clients, or other stakeholders. Documentation: Execute, organize, and prepare various sales-related documents, including quotations, purchase requests, purchase orders, order confirmations, and seminar invitations. Database Management: Manage the sales job and customer databases to ensure they are current, accurate, and complete. Customer Relationship: Help establish and maintain positive relationships with customers. Additional Responsibilities: Take on other assigned tasks as required. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in Business Administration, Management, Marketing, or a related field. (Graduates from Food Technology or Food Industry may be given special consideration.) Experience: Prior experience in the food industry, such as RD, QA, QC, Production, will be considered favorably. Language: Proficient in English communication (listening, speaking, reading, writing), primarily through email and phone communication. Skills: Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, responsibility, and ability to work effectively under pressure. Interpersonal Skills: Excellent interpersonal skills, open to feedback, and the ability to work well in a team. Computer Skills: Proficient in computer usage and basic Microsoft Office programs such as Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.

Job_Title: Claims Administrator – (French Speaking)
Job_Description: For over 30 years, APRIL International Care has been specializing in international health insurance solutions. We design, distribute, and manage insurance plans and assistance services for individuals and businesses. With teams across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, we look after our members wherever they are to make sure they have access to the best care. We are part of the APRIL Group, a global insurance specialist with 2,300 staff in 16 countries. To sustain the growth of the company as well as the expansion of our services we are currently looking for a Claims Administrator – (French Speaking). Duties & Responsibilities: Ensure the qualification of the cases (emails) in our salesforce tool : Deliver excellent customer service through high quality and efficient handling of policyholder’s claims Fill in the cases (Salesforce emails) with the information needed to link the email to the insured/underwriter's environment. Fill in the subject of the emails Dispatch the cases (Salesforce email) according to the services and the organization of the management services and close certain cases. Understand the clients' needs, eligibility, and coverage, and then provide qualified assistance services correspondingly Manage cases proactively by using our internal systems and communicating with all relevant departments Formulate, affect, interpret, or implement polices pertaining to strategic claim resolution Make prompt and timely decisions on policy cover and settlement costs Acquire information as necessary to perform accurate redress calculations Achieve set targets in line with required quality standards. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree (medical knowledge is a plus) 2+ years of experience in medical/life insurance underwriting or claims processing would be an asset for the role Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both French and English Proficient in problem-solving situations with multiple stakeholders and capable of developing alternative solutions Flexible, capable of working well under pressure and able to work as a team Customer-oriented with a service mindset Proficient in using computers, Microsoft Office, Internet, and E-mail. What we offer: You will be trained and coached to become proficient in a sought-after profession You will integrate into a dynamic and committed team of young professionals You will be offered development and career opportunities in a fast-growing tech-driven company Office located near BTS Chidlom Group Health Insurance & Provident Fund

Job_Title: Technical Support and Aftersales Services Representative
Company: SNC Atlantic Water Heater Asia Co., Ltd.
Job_Description: Job Purpose: As a Technical Support & Aftersales Services Representative, you are responsible for the technical support of our entire product range: Water heater, heat & ventilation. Also provide support with installation, technical and service questions from our end users, installers, and colleagues. Accountabilities & Responsibilities: As a Technical Support and Aftersales Services representative, you will ensure the correct functioning and performance of our products for our customers. With your ingenuity and creativity, you ensure that the complaint is resolved, and the customer is satisfied. You provide an optimal service that we can be proud of. Among other things, you will be involved in: ▪ Answering technical and service questions by e-mail and telephone. ▪ Take customer calls and provide accurate, satisfactory answers to their queries and concerns. ▪ Guide callers through troubleshooting, navigating the company site or using the products or services. ▪ Visiting service addresses. ▪ You will work in the office about once a week to bond with colleagues and to make service reports, among other things. ▪ Make sure you are always equipped with the right parts. Qualification: ▪ Diploma or bachelor’s degree in electrical, engineering, or related field ▪ Strong communication, both written and verbal. ▪ Great active listening skills ▪ A patient and empathetic attitude ▪ Computer literacy ▪ Phone skills, including familiarity with complex or multi-line phone systems would be advantage. ▪ In-depth knowledge of a company’s products and/or services ▪ In possession of driver's license ▪ Y have experience and/or have a demonstrable passion for the profession. ▪ Service-oriented and a self-starter. Work Location: Based in Bangkok (3 Months for training at Rayong)

Job_Title: HR Talent and Succession Planning Manager (230-250K)
Job_Description: Position: HR Talent and Success Planning Manager (230-250K) Benefits: 230,000-250,000 Baht salary + other benefits Based: Bangkok Contact Recruiter: Sirinapa ( 086-378-4083 ) Responsibility:- Design & Build Design, deliver, and continuously improve specific talent processes including performance management, talent reviews and succession planning projects. Influence the evolution of processes to meet stakeholder needs. Refine current performance review processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, coaching, feedback and calibration. Build out build out/implement additional features such as talent reviews, IDP and PIP Define requirements for refinement of performance and development processes and help to interpret and guide the HRIS team to ensure accurate configuration. Create supporting artifacts and tools to help end users effectively complete talent processes. Partnering with L&D, build talent management programs to strengthen our talent pipeline, including but not exclusive to talent assessment, career pathing and other resources to strengthen leadership talent pools. Talent Management & Succession Planning Help to shape the talent management strategy and roadmap. Assess and develop current and future executive leadership talent. Lead a cross-functional team and develop a global playbook and launch capability-building sessions to HRBPs and Stakeholder across the business. Build our Talent Segmentation plan with enhanced definitions, clarity on timing and level of leaders we will assess globally and in each region to drive greater rigor in how we assess leadership potential and use it to drive differentiated talent investment decisions. Track Enterprise Critical Role succession and support with preparations for Executive Leadership Team, reporting on progress to our bench strength and diversity. Identify next tier of Critical Roles in partnership with Talent Partners and HRBPs and clarify succession approach, roles and responsibilities, and system requirements. Partner with People Analytics partners to define key actions and metrics to increase accountability and measure quality of talent segmentation, talent review and succession processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or Master’s Degree in Human Resource Management or related field. 7-10 years’ experience in HR and Talent or related field, with demonstrated experience supporting organization wide HR projects in any of the following domains including talent management, organizational development, people analytics, etc. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with strong orientation and skill set in leveraging data to draw insights. Self-motivated and able to work independently to deliver on critical milestones, effectively managing multiple high-priority projects simultaneously. Strong planner and project manager, with ability to lead organization-wide program design and implementation in complex environment keeping employee/participant experience top of mind. Ability to drive results in a fast paced, agile manner while also maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Critical thinker who applies organizational understanding to advocate for continuous improvement to programs for achievement of strategy and enterprise goals. Change management skillset and expertise. Ability to influence and adapt style to collaborate with stakeholders across different levels, with a strong orientation towards solutions and consultative techniques. Exceptional communication skills, including ability to prepare executive level materials and presentations. Deals well with ambiguity to take the unknown forward and knows when to ask for help. Attractive salary and generous fringe benefits will be offered to the successful candidates. Interested candidates please send your application letter with resume, current and expected salary with contact details and refer the position If you believe that you are the right one, call Sirinapa "NOW" 086-3784083

Job_Title: Secretary and Administration/เลขานุการและธุรการ
Job_Description: หน้าที่และความรับผิดชอบ 1 ประสานงานและติดตามงานกับบุคลากรทั้งภายในและภายนอกองค์กร 2 ทำการนัดหมายและจัดตารางการนัดหมาย 3 ดูแลรับผิดชอบความเรียบร้อยงานเอกสารต่างๆ รวมทั้งจัดทำเอกสาร จดหมาย อีเมลโต้ตอบและพิมพ์งานต่างๆ ที่สำคัญ 4 สามารถแก้ไขปัญหา ข้อขัดแย้งเกี่ยวกับงานเบื้องต้น 5 จัดเตรียมเอกสาร วิเคราะห์ข้อมูล ตามงานที่ได้รับมอบหมาย เพื่อประกอบการตัดสินใจ 6 จัดทำรายงานที่สนับสนุนงานผู้บริหาร 7 ศึกษา แลกเปลี่ยน เรียนรู้ คิด วิเคราะห์ สร้างสรรค์ จัดทำและดำเนินการในงานที่ได้รับมอบหมายอย่างเป็นระบบ และมีประสิทธิภาพ พร้อมนำเสนอผู้บริหาร 8 ติดตามการทำงานจากคณะทำงานใน Project ต่างๆ ติดตาม Work Flow และส่วนงานความรับผิดชอบต่างๆ พร้อมรายงานผู้บริหาร 9 คิดและวิเคราะห์ข้อมูลทางการตลาด จัดทำรายงาน นำเสนอผู้บริหาร 10 งานอื่นๆ ตามที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติ 1ระดับการศึกษาปริญญาตรีขึ้นไป 2มีทักษะด้านภาษาอังกฤษ สามารถพูด อ่าน เขียน และสื่อสารได้ดี 3มีทักษะในการใช้คอมพิวเตอร์ โปรแกรมMS Office, Google Sheet ได้อย่างคล่องแคล่ว 4มีทักษะด้านการสื่อสารที่ชัดเจน มีมนุษยสัมพันธ์ดี มีบุคลิกภาพดี มีความคล่องแคล่วและคล่องตัวสูง 5 มีทักษะในการจัดการ ประสานงานได้เป็นอย่างดี มีความสามารถในการทำงานหลายอย่างพร้อมกัน 6 มีปฏิภาณไหวพริบ ใส่ใจรายละเอียด ใช้วิจารณญานอย่างเป็นอิสระและเหมาะสม 7 มีความสามารถในการคิด วิเคราะห์ สร้างสรรค์งานอย่างเป็นระบบ กล้าตัดสินใจ สามารถแก้ไขปัญหาเฉพาะหน้าได้ 8 มีความสามารถในการศึกษา แลกเปลี่ยน พร้อมเรียนรู้สิ่งใหม่ๆ อยู่เสมอ 9  มีความรับผิดชอบต่อหน้าที่ ขยัน ซื่อสัตย์ อดทน มีความละเอียด รอบคอบ มีความกระตือรือร้นในการทำงานภายใต้สภาวะความกดดันสูงได้เป็นอย่างดี

Job_Title: Personal Assistant to Group CEO
Job_Description: About Us KWI Public Company Limited by its subsidiary is determined to develop a business ecosystem in life insurance, general insurance, asset management and property development where synergies are being created to offer clients holistic products and services with the customer-centric philosophy. Job Summary We are looking for a resourceful “Senior Personal Assistant to Group CEO” to join our team. As a Senior Personal Assistant, you will be the focal point of contact for the Group CEO and family members, providing exceptional service and assistance. Your role will involve helping the Group CEO and family members with a wide range of personal affairs, such as household management, travel and security, personal assistance, recommendations to addressing inquiries and solving problems. If you have excellent communication skills and a passion for ensuring a positive experience for those you serve, we invite you to apply. Key Responsibilities Manage the day-to-day operations of the residence of the Group CEO, ensuring seamless coordination among domestic staff, including housekeepers, chefs, and drivers, to uphold a comfortable and efficiently organized environment. Coordinate and facilitate personalized services to meet individual requirements, encompassing transportation, lodging, personal care, dining and entertainment, and leisure activities, with a commitment to delivering the utmost level of service excellence in every aspect. Accompany the Group CEO and/or family members where necessary to ensure their safety and security in various environments, including public appearances, work, and travels (inclusive of Business and Personal agendas) Serve as central liaison with various stakeholders both internal and external to the organization, encompassing but not limited to Executives, Head of Business Units, and Employees Direct relevant service provider(s) to deliver personalized service to meet the unique preferences and needs of the Group CEO and/or family members by anticipating and fulfilling requests promptly. Oversees administrative responsibilities, including the management of household budgets, financial accounts, and inventory, while maintaining the highest standards of discretion and professionalism in handling sensitive and confidential information Provide leadership in coaching and developing junior personal assistants to ensure standard performance level of the overall Personal Assistant function. Job Requirements At least 3+ years of experience in Personal Assistant, Concierge, Guest Service, or other roles in Hospitality is preferred. Bachelor's degree in any field. Hospitality Management or a related field is a plus. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills Good verbal and written communication in English and Thai. Mandarin Chinese is a plus. Flexibility to work in varied shifts per required, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Job_Title: HR Manager - Chiang Mai/ผู้จัดการแผนกทรัพยากรบุคคล (Strong HRD)
Job_Description: หน้าที่ความรับผิดชอบ กำหนดวางแผนกลยุทธ์งาน HR เพื่อให้บรรลุเป้าหมายของทีมและบริษัทฯ และนำเสนอนโยบายการบริหารและการกำหนดกลยุทธงานด้านการบริหาร งานด้านทรัพยากรมนุษย์ (HRM และ HRD) วางแผนอัตรากำลังคนและการสรรหา และคัดสรรกำลังคนเพื่อให้งานมีความต่อเนื่องทั้งระบบ จัดทำ Organization กำหนดและจัดทำ Job Description วิเคราะห์หน้าที่ความรับผิดชอบงานให้ตรงกับJob Description จัดทำแบบประเมินประจำปี KPIs, Competency ,Corporate Culture พัฒนาพนักงานทั้งองค์กรให้สอดคล้องกับกลยุทธ์และวิสัยทัศน์ของบริษัท ฝึกอบรม สำรวจ Training Need , จัดทำแผนอบรมประจำปี , กำหนดการอบรมและดำเนินการจัดอบรมตามแผนที่กำหนดไว้ และประเมินผลการอบรม บริหารงานสวัสดิการ จัดสรรสวัสดิการพนักงาน วางแผนและจัดกิจกรรมสร้างความพันธ์ที่ดีในองค์กร ควบคุมดูแลกฎระเบียบข้อบังคับและเอกสารอื่นๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้องให้สอดคล้องกับกฎหมายแรงงานและกฎหมายอื่นๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้อง คุณสมบัติ ปริญญาตรีขึ้นไป สาขาการจัดการทรัพยากรมนุษย์ การพัฒนาทรัพยากรมนุษย์ มีประสบการณ์ในด้านงานทรัพยากรบุคคลในระดับผู้จัดการอย่างน้อย 5 ปี หากมีประสบการณ์ในอุตสาหกรรมผลิตยาหรือเครื่องมือแพทย์ จะได้รับการพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษ สามารถใช้โปรแกรมคอมพิวเตอร์ขั้นพื้นฐานได้ เช่น MS-Office มีทักษะการใช้ภาษาอังกฤษ ฟัง พูด อ่าน เขียน อยู่ในเกณฑ์ดี มีความรู้ด้านการบริหารฝ่ายทรัพยากรบุคคลทั้งระบบ มีความรู้ด้านกฎหมายแรงงานและกฎหมายที่เกี่ยวข้องเป็นอย่างดี มีวุฒิภาวะ บุคลิกภาพดีและมนุษยสัมพันธ์ดี มีทักษะการแก้ไขปัญหาเฉพาะหน้าได้ดี ใจเย็น ละเอียดรอบคอบ มีทักษะการสื่อสารที่ดี ประสบการณ์และความรู้ KPI & Competency หรือระบบคุณภาพต่างๆ

Job_Title: Human Resources Officer (D-Prep's New Campus)
Job_Description: Position Objectives Human Resources (HR) Officer is generally assigned to support Thailand HR Manager to provide services to School Management Team and employees in all areas of HR and relevant tasks in all schools in Thailand for the achievement of efficient and qualified services for schools and employees. Responsibilities Talent Acquisition Provide coordination and assistance in the end-to-end recruitment process, from resume screening, shortlisting, interview coordination, reference checks, and offer letters, ensuring the process is effective and compliant. Review and track all applications that come through the Careers website. Advertise positions on school websites, local websites and with agencies for vacancies that arise within the School. Coordinate interviews and correspond with candidates. Conduct Reference check and Background check. Onboarding and Offboarding of Employees Coordinate with HR team to ensure smooth onboarding and offboarding for the employees Supporting managers in Onboarding process including arrange for onboarding plan Perform New Hire check-in and Exit Interview for employees Prepare and follow-up on the Probation Evaluation process. Support HR Manager to conduct new employee orientation and induction Compensation & Benefits administration Enroll and remove employees from insurance plans, Social Security and Provident Fund. Manage benefit databases and ensure that such benefits align with school policy, for example, leave, and medical insurance benefits Process registration and termination of employees and family members’ medical insurance and reimbursement, Social Security, payroll process, allowances and other benefits Responsible for updating information for payroll by working closely with the Asst. HR Manager to support all data Compliance and Policy Responsible for the implementation, training and administration of HR policies, programs and processes, ensuring staff have access to up-to-date documents in a consistent and timely manner. Support HR Manager in disciplinary and compliance cases that may arise. Performance Management and Development Supporting with employee annual performance review and trainings & development, including Safeguarding Supporting HR Manager with workplace conflicts and grievances through effective mediation, and conducting investigations as necessary Employee Relations and Engagement Consulting with Managers to provide daily HR support Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention Promoting Employee Engagement and support in Action Planning process Supporting with employee annual performance review and trainings & development, including Safeguarding Others Create, maintain and update employee files, data, and HR system Contribute to the on-going development of HR policies and programs. Perform other human resources and administrative duties as assigned by Human Resource and Administrative teams. Requirements Ideally 5 years or more experience in a generalist HR role. Diploma or degree in HR or related discipline. Sound working knowledge of Thailand employment laws and regulations Excellent in Communication and People skills Experience in Recruitment including Expat employee Highly motivated with an eye for detail and quality of work. Customer focus Confident in presentation skills Must be reliable and flexible, with ability to multitask and meet deadlines. Proven ability to build trust, credibility and forge effective working relationships at all levels in the organisation. Must have outstanding English proficiency, both spoken and written. Ability to work independently, as well as in a team, with people from multi-national and diverse backgrounds. Advanced Microsoft Office Suites including Word and Excel. Experience in a multi-national organisation is an advantage, especially with expats.

Job_Title: แอดมินประจำสำนักงาน/แอดมินประจำสำนักงาน
Job_Description: แอดมินประจำสำนักงาน เงินเดือน : 20,000 บาท หรือ ตามประสบการณ์ ลักษณะงานและความรับผิดชอบ ช่วยดูแลงานเอกสารให้กับทีม จัดเก็บข้อมูลงานต่างๆเช่นรวบรวมและจัดระเบียบข้อมูลบริษัท ดูแลเรื่องการต่อใบอนุญาตต่างๆ ดูแลรักษาอุปกรณ์และความเรียบร้อยของสำนักงาน ดูแลสั่งซื้ออุปกรณ์สำนักงาน ดูแลรับ-ส่งเอกสารและบุคคลภายนอกที่มาติดต่อกับบริษัท รับผิดชอบงานอื่นๆที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติ วุฒิปริญญาตรี ยินดีรับเด็กจบใหม่ ชอบจัดระเบียบ จัดเอกสาร จัดบ้าน ชอบความเรียบร้อยมากๆ สื่อสารภาษาอังกฤษเบื้องต้นได้ (จะได้รับการพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษ) สามารถใช้โปรแกรมคอมพิวเตอร์ Microsoft Office, Words, Excel มีทักษะการทำงานหลายอย่างได้ในเวลาเดียวกัน จัดลำดับความสำคัญของงานตนเองได้ดี รับผิดชอบหน้าที่ของตนเองที่ได้รับมอบหมายให้สำเร็จภายในเวลาที่กำหนด มีความละเอียดรอบคอบใส่ใจรายละเอียดของงานที่ทำ มีทักษะการติดต่อประสานงานกับบุคคลภายในองค์กรและภายนอกองค์กรได้ดี บุคลิกดีรับฟังผู้อื่นรอบคอบและรู้จักแก้ไขปัญหาเฉพาะหน้าได้ดี มีทัศนะคติที่ดีต่อองค์กรและผู้ร่วมงาน มีทักษะการเรียนรู้ที่รวดเร็วพร้อมเรียนรู้สิ่งใหม่ๆตลอดเวลา มีมนุษย์สัมพันธ์ที่ดีทำงานเป็นทีมด้วยความสามัคคี มีความซื่อสัตย์ตรงต่อเวลาและมีความรับผิดชอบต่อหน้าที่ มีวุฒิภาวะด้านอารมณ์วาจา สามารถรับมือกับการทำงานหรือสถานการณ์ที่มีความกดดันได้ เวลาทำงาน จันทร์ - ศุกร์   เวลา 09.00น. - 18.00น. วันหยุด : เสาร์ - วันอาทิตย์และวันนักขัตฤกษ์(เงื่อนไขเป็นไปตามข้อตกลงของบริษัทฯที่กำหนด) สถานที่ทำงาน สำนักงานใหญ่ที่แจ้งวัฒนะ

Job_Title: Inside Sales Agent / Sales Coordinator / Sales Support
Job_Description: #BeMore Do you aspire for a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company. Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore! As an Inside Sales Agent, you will be working with our Lab Equipment & Devices Account to deliver #happier customer experience. As an Inside Sales Agent, your primary responsibility is to reach out to all known potential customers to verify the opportunity from which it can be converted to a sales funnel. In addition, you will need to identify unknown potential customers for the same purpose. You also will be working with analytical instruments, consumables, or services in a scientific laboratory. Top reasons to work with TDCX. Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage World-class workspaces Engaging activities and recognition programs Strong learning and development plans for your career growth Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport Flexible working arrangements Be coached and mentored by experts in your field Join a global company, winner of hundreds of industry awards What is your mission? Reach prospective customers through phone and email and conduct outbound prospecting calls. initially from lists provided by our client's sales/marketing teams to access business potential. Conduct outbound prospection calls for Prospects Lists collected from External Directory or conference, Profile and nurture customers from the call and eventually converting to Customers. Responsible for generating existing and/or new sales leads and business opportunities through outbound prospection calls, handle complex leads, qualified and nurture the leads to potential business opportunities for assigned territory. Represent our client’s products and services, develop comprehensive understanding to assigned accounts or assigned geographic, territories or industries to identify how our solutions can meet needs Develop strong customer relationship and satisfaction Manage existing accounts, drive organic growth, and develop new accounts and key performance indicators will include: Quota achievement Growth in existing accounts New business and customer’s experience Develop strong customer relationship and satisfaction. Sending out direct mails and following up over the phone until decision makers are reached or maximum number of contact attempts have been reached. Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management from time to time, within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance, and continual improvement of the ISO9001 and ISO18295-1 Quality Management System of TDCX. Daily and Monthly Responsibilities: Maintain and build relationships with existing and new customers to ensure high level of service satisfaction and identification of potential new business opportunities. Identify sales prospects, outbound prospection calls to dark or new prospects, set appointments with customers virtually, make effective qualifying sales calls, and manage sales cycle to close new business in all service products offered. Possess in-depth product knowledge and be able to provide consultative advice to sales prospects to achieve sales objectives. Manage daily sales-oriented activities such as sales discussion, presentation, order bookings, and other documentation. Utilization of SAP CRM for updating the funnel and reporting Timely respond to calls/emails. Update CRM customer profiles during each outbound call to ensure the system reflects the current situation at customer accounts. Ensure any created funnel are forwarded to our client via the CRM system, as a sale opportunity at the account level in real time. Total number of outbound calls or prospection per day should be no less than 20 and each call has to be updated in the CRM as an interaction history. Who are we looking for? BA/BS degree in any field but graduates from Chemistry Science/Biotech or other related medical course will be preferred. 2-3 years of experience in sales, or sales administration. Prior experience in acquisition sales would be preferred. Strong understanding and experience in the digital advertising market. Previous experience in both traditional and digital advertising would be preferred. Outstanding written and oral communication skills. Previous direct sales experience would be preferred. Fluency in native languages of markets served. English ability a plus in non-English speaking markets, and required in mixed-language markets. Who is TDCX? TDCX (NYSE: TDCX) provides transformative digital CX solutions, enabling world-leading and disruptive brands to acquire new customers, build customer loyalty, and protect their online communities. TDCX helps clients, including many of the world’s best brands, achieve their customer experience aspirations by harnessing technology, human intelligence, and our global footprint. We serve clients in fintech, gaming, technology, home sharing and travel, digital advertising and social media, streaming, and e-commerce. Our expertise and strong footprint in Asia have made us a trusted partner for clients, particularly high-growth, new economy companies looking to tap the region’s growth potential. We pride ourselves on discovering and employing the best professionals to join us as we transform the outsourced CX industry. Our commitment to #BeMore for our people, our clients, and our community has led to us winning several hundreds of industry awards, including being one of the best companies to work for in Asia. From our first-rate workspaces, above-industry-average compensation packages, career opportunities, to our workplace perks, find out what else is in store when you embark on a career with TDCX.

It comprises future workplaces, a new retail loop, luxury residences, five-star hospitality, an entertainment arena, art and culture, and a vast, welcoming public realm covering 50 rai of the district. Job_Title: Associate Manager, Field HR
Job_Description: As the Associate Manager, Field HR, you are responsible for supporting the execution of Human Resources (HR) initiatives within Thailand. You will support the business by aligning with HR Operations, Centre of Excellence (COE), and HR Business Partners (HRBP) in all aspects of Human Resources, to deliver HR programs and initiatives across the organization. You will also support a wide range of HR functions which include employee relations, onboarding, talent management, leadership development, change management, diversity, performance management, workforce planning and compensation planning / implementation. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Partner with Business Unit HRBP to provide proactive guidance, communications,   and  HR generalist support to employees. Ensure consistent application and compliance of HR policies / procedures and local laws and practices as well as partner with HR Operations team and the COE’s to ensure consistent execution of HR policies and initiatives. Support execution of HR programs and processes, manage different priorities concurrently through project management, systems knowledge, and effective communications. Support team members in the implementation of HR initiatives within the country, and support HR team in resolving HR operational issues. Lead change management programs and initiatives, lead employee engagement initiatives and cultural programs, as well as the implementation and/or execution of applicable training programs. Lead Labor Relations Strategy to support business strategy. Lead local payroll process. Support the non-production Talent Acquisition Process and onboarding. Support special projects, compensation process and the delivery of Talent Management & Organizational Effectiveness programs such as Performance Management Process (PMP), Management, Succession & Development (MS&D), Great Place to Work (GPTW), Global Employee Opinion Survey (GEOS), etc. Manage International Mobility, inbound and outbound. Required Skills / Experience / Competencies: Bachelor’s in Human Resources, Business Administration, Management, or related   discipline Minimum 6 to 8 years of HR generalist, HR Operations experience and/or related fields Knowledge of general HR policies, procedures, and HR leading practices and applicable laws/regulations in the country of employment. Experience in Payroll, HR operations and government related. Experience in Payroll, HR operations and government related. be able to communicate in English. Benefits & Culture! SC Johnson is committed to providing a Great Place to Work for all its employees. Along with a competitive base salary, here are just some of the benefits you receive when joining the SC Johnson Family - Ongoing training and development Free onsite parking Subsidized fitness sessions Family-owned company, with a family feel. Be a member of a company championing a better world through sustainability               and environmental protection measures. SC Johnson Asia has been recognized as the Best Multinational Workplace by Great Place to Work® !

Job_Title: Talent Acquisition
Job_Description: Manage the full-life cycle recruitment process. Responsible for day-to-day activities of recruitment and selection functions to meet with the company strategy and timeline; including the job description reviews, placing the advertisement, correspondence with the candidate, pre-screening and interview process and etc. Responsible for hiring corporate and support positions, managing, planning and developing recruitment function. Deploy appropriate sourcing methodology to source right candidates for various jobs in a speedy and cost-effective manner to ensure the selection process is effective. Check and update information for various online channels regarding job postings. Working with the others department and/or line supervisor-manager for the recruitment process and company strategy. Prepare and conduct orientation program and issue contract to the new staff as well as co-operate with others department. Liaise with the Payroll, IT and Corporate Services teams to make on-boarding arrangements Prepare and update weekly reports in relation to recruitment, hiring and manpower. Prepare job descriptions for each new position and update JD for current positions. Initiate project to improve recruitment efficiency. Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned by the management Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or master’s degree in human resource management, Business Administration, or any related filed. Experience at least 3 years in Human Resource work role such as recruitment activities, candidate interview, etc. Had experience working as In-House recruiter or job hunter companies, agencies would be a plus. Had experience working in recruitment call center / telesales is a plus Had experience searching for candidate with executive, professional and technical expertise is preferred. Had experience in a full life cycle of international recruitment structure. Good English skills (communication, reading, writing) Multitask skill, interpersonal skill, Initiative and proactive personality. Had experience working in BPO business is a plus.

Job_Title: Company Secretary Manager/ผู้จัดการเลขานุการและองค์กรสัมพันธ์
Job_Description: Arrange and prepare necessary documents for shareholders’ meetings (AGM and EGM), BOD and sub-committee meetings; Prepare meeting agenda, documents and ensure their timely distribution; Ensure that all meetings have arranged in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations, the Articles of Association, and best corporate governance (CG) principles; Draft Annual Report and other official reports for the SET and SEC office submission; Familiar with rules and regulations of SET and SEC; Provide registration document for the amendment of directors, list of shareholders and any change in company i.e. Notice of Meetings, Minute of the Meeting and applications; Provide advice to shareholders on their legitimate rights and on the company’s information and serving as a legal advisor between shareholders, directors, and executive; and Monitor regulatory requirements and practices as concern company business and directorship in order to provide initial recommendations. Key Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree or higher with major in law or related fields; Minimum 5 years’ work experience in legal field and minimum 3 years’ work experience in company secretary field (listed company is preferable); Fully understand in SET and SEC rules in related to Company Secretary functions; Have knowledge in both public and private company and commercial laws; Good communication skills both written and spoken in Thai and English; Well organize and co-ordination with strong communication skill; Eager to learn and explore business operation; Capable to lead working team in assigned projects; and Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).

Job_Title: Admin

Job_Title: HR Payroll & Benefit
Job_Description: Overall values: Passionate in Aura. Strong passion in bringing a high-quality medical service to everyone at a reasonable price. Always stay in a fast-paced, revenue-driven work environment. Always analyze and optimize on-the-go. We are bringing the aesthetic industry towards a new break through, there will be many obstacles. Persevere through all of them. We value high-growth employees and reward them handsomely. Evaluate and give constructive feedback your team to support high-growth career path. Excellent presentation skill with strong logical thinking. Excellent management skill. Always plan ahead. Always have backup plan. Strong can-do attitude. Always strive only for the best. Always go beyond expectation. Always set an almost impossible goal. Never settle for an easy one. Purpose of the position: To ensure fair and accurate compensation, including regular salaries, allowance, and any additional of employee benefits. Key Responsibilities: 1. Compensation Manage monthly payroll process for AHQ employees with accuracy and in a timely manner. Ensure accurate all payroll-related allowances and handle those reports to both internal and external concerned parties. (OT, Social security fund, Income tax, Provident fund, and other legal requirements) Monitor all claimed allowances such as Travel allowance, Activity reward, and other Aura benefits. Support manager for annual salary increments, promotion process, and related operations. Compare salary surveys and benchmark against competitors to understand prevailing market rates. Prepare and issue the withholding tax certificate. 2. Non-cash benefits Manage and monitor employees’ leave. Coordinate with health insurance broker and provident fund manager. Coordinate training course with an academy and assign them to Department of Skill Development. Manage office facilities such as F&B, Stationary, etc. to ensure that Aura people are well-treated. 3. Reporting Generate monthly/yearly report to HR Team Lead, Finance Team, and CEO. Create customized dashboards to assist HR and management in decision-making. Key Qualifications & Skills : Bachelor’s degree in any field. At least 1 year of experience in Payroll Management, People relations or related. Knowledge of labour and social security laws. Problem solving and Analytic skill. Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and time management skill. Good English language skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Life at Aura Semi-flexible Office hour: 9.30-18.30 Smart Casual Dress Code 2-min walk from BTS Chongnonsi (Sathon) Positive-energetic teammates Free lunch Unlimited snacks and drinks Annual vaccination Premium Health and Life insurance with Family Benefits High yield, high pop up Provident Fund plan Child Education Benefits Clinic service for free or at great cost Extra Benefits to keep your Professional Look and Feel Fit Special member price with Fitness first and Virgin Active Thailand Entertainment zone; Nintendo switch, PS, Board games etc. Grab your favorite reading from our bookshelf Shower room with hotel amenities Luxury massage chair to keep office syndrome away Sleep box, take a rest and get up with fresher energy and much more! Explore us at IG: life.at.aura

Job_Description: We are looking for an Operations Manager/Executive Assistant to assist in the agency's day-to-day finance, human resource and admin tasks. Qualifications: 2-3 years experience in HR, Finance or as a executive assistant Speaks English and Thai Detail oriented and proactive Trustworthy Willing to learn how to use digital platforms like Monday.com Proficient with use of Apple Macbook Computer Roles and responsibilities Finance (35% of job) Be the point of contact for our accounting/tax/payroll team. Enroll newcomers for group insurance. Admin (15% of job) Manage the office space- be the point of contact for external cleaners. In charge of office hardware- call for repairs when needed. Manage office & snack supplies.

Company: Thai Central Chemical Public Co., Ltd.
Job_Description: Job Highlights: - Provide comprehensive administrative support to CEO/President. - Act as a bridge between the CEO and diverse stakeholders - Prepare and review correspondence, reports, and presentation. Roles & Responsibilities: - Act as the primary point of contact and provide administrative support to Management. - Assist in the planning and execution of events, conferences, and other engagements involving the President. - Liaise and collaborate with internal and external functions on related matters. - Draft and proofread correspondence, reports, and presentations for the President. - Oversee the daily operations of the executive office, including managing incoming calls, emails, and other communications. - Assist and manage special or ad-hoc projects assigned by the executive. Qualifications: -  Bachelor with 1-2 years experiences in related fields -  Professional demeanor in both grooming and personality. -  Fluency in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills. -  Excellent interpersonal, verbal and writing communication skills -  Ability to prioritize tasks and managing schedule and deadlines

JOB DESCRIPTION: Oversee comprehensive administrative operations, ensuring strict adherence to industrial regulations and laws. Enhance administrative systems for ongoing efficiency and efficacy. Supervise subordinates to guarantee seamless operation of diverse services. Coordinate and oversee safety and environmental initiatives across the organization. Manage ISO14001 and ISO45001 processes, including internal and external audits. Organize and prepare for various events such as plant tours, government audits, and assigned activities. Monitor and manage cost expenses across all administrative functions. Ensure all office service needs are met and administrative tasks are executed seamlessly. You will be discussing more in-depth descriptions with a consultant in the interview session. QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Administration, General Management or other related field. At least 10 years of experience in Administrative functions Experience in Manufacturing industry and Automotive Firms Experience in multinational company is preferred Computer literacy: MS Office Good command of English (Japanese is a plus) Salary: Attractive (Based on experiences) Benefits: Bonus, Group Insurance (OPD/IPD), Provident Fund, other attractive benefits. **Only Shortlisted Candidates will be Considered** If you are interested, please do not hesitate to send your full English resume by clicking Apply. Job_Title: Personal Assistant to CEO
Job_Description: TeC บริษัทที่ปรึกษาด้านดิจิทัลโซลูชั่นชั้นนำในไทยระดับ Asia-Pacific โดยเฉพาะอาเซียนและจีน กำลังมองหาคนมีไฟ ชอบพูดคุย ขยัน และสนุกกับการติดต่อประสานงาน ขายสินค้าบริการ ทำการตลาด มาร่วมกันติดต่อลูกค้าทั้ง SMEs และบริษัท Corporates/ Enterprises ชั้นนำในประเทศไทย นำเสนอ Product / Services solution ของ TeC ที่มีดีมากมาย อาทิ บริการด้านที่ปรึกษาดิจิทัล บริการธุรกิจระหว่างประเทศ ไทย อาเซียน/จีน บริการด้านเทรนนิ่งดิจิทัล บริการด้านวางแผนธุรกิจด้วยผู้เชี่ยวชาญดิจิทัล เป็นต้น แค่คุณพร้อมเรียนรู้สิ่งใหม่ เราพร้อมจะสอนและทำให้คุณเติบโตในบริษัทเราได้อย่างดีเยี่ยม เรามีคอมมิชชั่นที่ดึงดูดใจรอคุณอยู่! Personal Assistant to CEO Responsibilities: Coordinate and organize the CEO's calendar, ensuring efficient time management and prioritizing key activities. Respond to emails, messages, and other communications on behalf of the CEO, maintaining professionalism and confidentiality. Schedule, prepare for, and follow up on meetings, ensuring the CEO is well-prepared and documentation is handled effectively. Plan and coordinate travel logistics, including flights, accommodations, and itineraries for the CEO's business trips. Maintain and organize important documents, reports, and files, ensuring quick and easy access for the CEO. Manage incoming calls and visitors, screening and prioritizing requests to optimize the CEO's time. Assist in preparing reports, presentations, and other documents as needed by the CEO. Conduct research on various topics to provide the CEO with accurate and up-to-date information. Manage sensitive and confidential information with discretion and integrity. Plan and organize corporate events, conferences, and meetings, overseeing logistics and details. Act as a point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders, ensuring effective communication. Track and manage the CEO's expenses, preparing accurate and timely expense reports. Oversee the CEO's social media presence, ensuring posts align with the professional image of the company. Address issues and challenges proactively, finding solutions and presenting options to the CEO. Provide ad hoc administrative and operational support as needed by the CEO. Collaborate with other executives and department heads to facilitate seamless communication and workflow. Manage responsibilities associated with the CEO serving as both the CEO and President of Thai e-Commerce Association, ensuring seamless coordination and support for both roles. Take care of speaker-related tasks, including replying to invitations, negotiating speaker fees, providing necessary information for drafting artwork, and scheduling slots for speakers, moderators, keynotes, or panel sessions. Qualifications: Experience as an executive assistant or personal assistant, preferably supporting C-level executives. Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently. Strong organizational abilities with attention to detail and ability to multitask. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, demonstrating professionalism and clarity. High level of discretion and ability to handle confidential information with integrity. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant productivity tools. Ability to anticipate and resolve issues independently. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work in a dynamic environment. Proactive approach to tasks, anticipating needs and taking initiative. Maintain a high level of professionalism and represent the CEO's office with poise and confidence. สวัสดิการ (welfare benefit) วันหยุดตามธนาคารแห่งประเทศไทย ลาพักร้อนประจำปี ประกันสังคม โบนัส (ขึ้นอยู่กับผลประกอบการณ์ของบริษัทฯ ) ประกันกลุ่ม/ประกันอุบัติเหตุเพิ่มเติม (เมื่อครบ Term of services) กิจกรรมสันทนาการ งานเลี้ยงปีใหม่ ทริปในประเทศและต่างประเทศ (ขึ้นอยู่กับผลประกอบการ)

Job_Description: Our client is a global leader in industrial product manufacturing. Responsibilities Supporting the team to establish basic plans to achieve key business goals. Preparing for, and participating in key meetings, taking and distributing minutes, and following up on action items. Scheduling Coordinating meetings between Management, staff and customers/suppliers. Helping organise and reorganise the calendar to help the Manager to keep on top of his days. Very strong written and verbal English skills. High level of MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) skills. Medium level of understanding of/experience with project planning. Attention to detail. Job_Description: บริษัท ปคุณ จำกัด เจ้าหน้าที่ธุรการ-บัญชี สถานที่ปฏิบัติงาน อ.เมืองสมุทรปราการ จ.สมุทรปราการ เงินเดือน 10,000-15,000บาท อัตรา 1 ตำแหน่ง รายละเอียดงาน - จัดทำเอกสารทางด้านบัญชีและการเงิน เช่น ใบแจ้งหนี้ ภาษีซื้อ ภาษีขาย หนังสือรับรองการหักภาษี ณ ที่จ่าย เป็นต้น - จัดเตรียมเอกสารทางบัญชีเพื่อส่งสำนักงานบัญชีรายเดือน - ทำการวางบิลและรับเช็ค - คีย์ข้อมูลต่างๆ - กระทบยอดธนาคาร - งานต่างๆที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติผู้สมัคร - จบการศึกษา ระดับปวชขึ้นไป มีประสบการณ์ในงานขายอย่างน้อย 1 ปีสาขาทางบัญชี การเงิน หรือสาขาที่เกี่ยวข้อง - มีความขยัน อดทน และซื่อสัตย์ มีความคิดริเริ่มสร้างสรรค์ - มีทักษะในการติดต่อประสานงานที่ดี มีบุคลิกภาพดี คล่องแคล่ว และมนุษยสัมพันธ์เป็นเลิศ - มีความละเอียดและกระตือรือร้นในการทำงาน - มีทัศนคติเชิงบวกต่องานขาย ลูกค้า ผู้บังคับบัญชา และผู้ร่วมงาน - สามารถใช้งานโปรแกรม Express , Microsoft Excel ได้อย่างคล่องแคล่ว - ชอบงานด้านตัวเลข มีความละเอียดรอบคอบ ซื่อสัตย์ แก้ปัญหาเฉพาะหน้าได้ดี และมี ความรับผิดชอบ - สุขภาพแข็งแรง คล่องแคล่ว สวัสดิการบริษัทฯ - ประกันสังคม - ประกันชีวิต/สุขภาพ - โบนัสประจำปี และ กิจกรรมเที่ยวต่างจังหวัด/ต่างประเทศประจำปี(ขึ้นกับผลงานการทำงานและเงื่อนไขของบริษัทฯ) วิธีการสมัคร - สมัครได้ด้วยตนเองที่บริษัท วันจันทร์-ศุกร์ เวลา 10.00-16.30 น. - ติดต่อ คุณมะเหมี่ยว - บริษัท ปคุณ จำกัด - 599/70 หมู่บ้านกลางเมือง ถ.ศรีนครินทร์ - ตำบลสำโรงเหนือ อำเภอเมืองสมุทรปราการ จังหวัดสมุทรปราการ 10270 - โทรศัพท์ : 02-349-4149,089 -679-4155

Job_Title: HR Officer/เจ้าหน้าที่ทรัพยากรบุคคล
Job_Description: Main Responsibilities: Recruitment: Coordinate job postings on various websites, screen applications, schedule interviews for selected candidates, reserve meeting rooms/create links for online interviews, and prepare interview assessment forms. Manage and report the 90-day notification for foreign employees by submitting forms in person at the Immigration Offices in Nakhon Pathom, Nonthaburi, and the Chaloem Phra Kiat Government Center on Chaengwattana Road, Bangkok. Assist in document preparation and perform tasks related to the Immigration Offices and the Department of Employment as assigned. Handle the application/cancellation of emails for new employees and those leaving the organization. Coordinate health insurance for staff and student accident insurance, notifying new hires and managing departures. Summarize monthly and yearly attendance records, including work hours, absences, and leaves, for performance evaluations. Maintain an organized and up-to-date database of personnel within the school. Prepare documentation for the approval of nurse compensation claims. Manage the professional development allowance budget database and prepare documentation for approval for reimbursement. Submit personal information of school staff to the Ministry of Education, Science, Research and Innovation (SESRI) twice a year. Input employee card data for timekeeping purposes. Assist and coordinate tasks related to the HR department and perform other duties as assigned by the school. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's/Master's degree or equivalent in Human Resource Management. Excellent communication skills in both Thai and English. Teamwork skills. Good personal and interpersonal skills, with confidence at an appropriate level. Service-oriented, honest, and able to maintain confidentiality. Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. Detail-oriented and highly responsible. Ability to travel for work outside of the office and work beyond regular hours.

Job_Title: Human Resource Generalist, Thailand
Job_Description: About Symrise AG Symrise is a global supplier of fragrances, flavors, food, nutrition, and cosmetic ingredients. Its clients include manufacturers of perfumes, cosmetics, food and beverages, pharmaceuticals and producers of nutritional supplements and pet food. Its sales of € 4.6 billion in the 2022 fiscal year make Symrise a leading global provider. Headquartered in Holzminden, Germany, the Group is represented by more than 100 locations in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia, the United States and Latin America. Symrise works with its clients to develop new ideas and market-ready concepts for products that form an integral part of everyday life. Economic success and corporate responsibility are inextricably linked as part of this process. Symrise – always inspiring more… Human Resource Generalist, Thailand As a Human Resource Generalist, you will be responsible to oversee the local country HR operation functions including payroll and general administrative services, to foster a vibrant, affable work environment that promotes strong collaboration, creativity, high performance and continuous learning. You will report directly to HR Operations Head, SEA. The Position: Employee Onboarding and Offboarding Implement onboarding and offboarding processes to ensure a positive experience for new hires and departing employees. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to facilitate smooth transitions Payroll Perform full spectrum of payroll and tax reporting and ensure they are in compliant with the local governmental requirements and regulations. Prepare payroll-related reports. Employee Relations Provide guidance to employees and managers on HR policies, processes and procedures HR Policies and Compliance Implement and update HR policies, procedures, and guidelines in compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations Ensure local immigration and labor laws and regulations are observed and strictly adhered to Ensure adherence to data privacy and security standards HR Data and Reporting Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data input including employee records, benefits information, compensation data, and performance metrics Generate regular reports to support decision-making and compliance requirements Process Improvement and Efficiency Continuously assess and improve HR processes, identifying areas for automation, standardization, and streamlining Implement best practices and leverage technology to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. HR Projects and Initiatives Participate in various HR projects and initiatives, such as implementing HRIS systems, improving HR processes, or supporting organizational development efforts Stakeholder Management Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders, including business leaders and employees Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure HR initiatives are effectively communicated and integrated into business operations. HR Vendor Management Maintain relationships with HR service providers, such as recruitment agencies, payroll & employee management software vendors, benefits providers, outsourced-service vendors and background check agencies. Source, review and recommend outsourced vendors Provided feedback on vendor performance, negotiate contracts, and ensure service level agreements are met. General Service Management Supervise general service functions including reception, dispatch, office cleaning services, where applicable Budgeting Participate in the annual HR Budget process Prepare and propose annual HR budget for local HR Operations team Team Management Lead and manage local HR Operations team The Ideal Candidate: Degree in Human Resource Management or equivalent. Minimum 6 years’ HR experience with strong payroll background Good working knowledge and/or experiences in HR practices in a progressive multinational environment Strong knowledge and experience in HR operations management, including payroll administration, benefits administration and compliance. Familiarity with local labour laws and legislation. Familiarity with MS Office applications Experience with relevant legislative requirements Experience with technology-leveraged HR infrastructure Able to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Able to handle multiple priorities and work under pressure to meet timeline Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong ethics and commitment to maintaining confidentiality and handling sensitive HR information with discretion Organized, meticulous and proactive

Job_Title: Recruiter
Job_Description: Join CREA as a Recruiter to streamline our recruitment processes and manage administrative HR tasks. This unique dual-role is perfect for individuals who excel in talent acquisition and have a knack for efficient administrative management, keen to contribute across diverse departments including Operations, Marketing, Commercial, Technology, and Finance. Recruitment (80%): Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, from job posting to candidate onboarding, across various departments. Employ diverse sourcing techniques to attract top talent in Operations, Marketing, Commercial, Technology, and Finance. Conduct initial screenings and coordinate interviews, ensuring a smooth recruitment process. Build and maintain a talent pool for future openings in different areas of our business. Administrative Tasks (20%): Accurately maintain HR records and databases. Assist in essential office management and HR documentation. Organize HR events and activities to boost employee engagement Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, or a related field; fresh graduates welcome. Proficiency in MS Excel (VLOOKUP, PIVOT) and PowerPoint. Enthusiasm for the e-commerce industry and its dynamic nature. Fluent in both Thai and English with excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Strong organizational and time-management skills. Capability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced setting. We Offer: Clear career paths and focus on your financial well-being. Attractive benefits including Health/Life/Dental insurance. Generous vacation leave of 16+ days. Join Us: If you are ambitious, driven, and passionate about e-commerce, we want you! Apply now to be a part of CREA's diverse and innovative team. CREA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
